1: <sup>1</sup> I am the true vine, and my Father is the husbandman.
2: <sup>2</sup> Every branch in me that beareth not fruit he taketh away: and every branch that beareth fruit, he purgeth it, that it may bring forth more fruit.
3: <sup>3</sup> Now ye are clean through the word which I have spoken unto you.
4: <sup>4</sup> Abide in me, and I in you. As the branch cannot bear fruit of itself, except it abide in the vine; no more can ye, except ye abide in me.
5: <sup>5</sup> I am the vine, ye are the branches: He that abideth in me, and I in him, the same bringeth forth much fruit: for without me ye can do nothing.
6: <sup>6</sup> If a man abide not in me, he is cast forth as a branch, and is withered; and men gather them, and cast them into the fire, and they are burned.
7: <sup>7</sup> If ye abide in me, and my words abide in you, ye shall ask what ye will, and it shall be done unto you.
8: <sup>8</sup> Herein is my Father glorified, that ye bear much fruit; so shall ye be my disciples.
9: <sup>9</sup> As the Father hath loved me, so have I loved you: continue ye in my love.
10: <sup>10</sup> If ye keep my commandments, ye shall abide in my love; even as I have kept my Father’s commandments, and abide in his love.
11: <sup>11</sup> These things have I spoken unto you, that my joy might remain in you, and that your joy might be full.
12: <sup>12</sup> This is my commandment, That ye love one another, as I have loved you.
13: <sup>13</sup> Greater love hath no man than this, that a man lay down his life for his friends.
14: <sup>14</sup> Ye are my friends, if ye do whatsoever I command you.
15: <sup>15</sup> Henceforth I call you not servants; for the servant knoweth not what his lord doeth: but I have called you friends; for all things that I have heard of my Father I have made known unto you.
16: <sup>16</sup> Ye have not chosen me, but I have chosen you, and ordained you, that ye should go and bring forth fruit, and that your fruit should remain: that whatsoever ye shall ask of the Father in my name, he may give it you.
17: <sup>17</sup> These things I command you, that ye love one another.
18: <sup>18</sup> If the world hate you, ye know that it hated me before it hated you.
19: <sup>19</sup> If ye were of the world, the world would love his own: but because ye are not of the world, but I have chosen you out of the world, therefore the world hateth you.
20: <sup>20</sup> Remember the word that I said unto you, The servant is not greater than his lord. If they have persecuted me, they will also persecute you; if they have kept my saying, they will keep yours also.
21: <sup>21</sup> But all these things will they do unto you for my name’s sake, because they know not him that sent me.
22: <sup>22</sup> If I had not come and spoken unto them, they had not had sin: but now they have no cloak for their sin.
23: <sup>23</sup> He that hateth me hateth my Father also.
24: <sup>24</sup> If I had not done among them the works which none other man did, they had not had sin: but now have they both seen and hated both me and my Father.
25: <sup>25</sup> But this cometh to pass, that the word might be fulfilled that is written in their law, They hated me without a cause.
26: <sup>26</sup> But when the Comforter is come, whom I will send unto you from the Father, even the Spirit of truth, which proceedeth from the Father, he shall testify of me:
27: <sup>27</sup> And ye also shall bear witness, because ye have been with me from the beginning.
28: <sup>28</sup> And he was angry, and would not go in: therefore came his father out, and intreated him.
29: <sup>29</sup> And he answering said to his father, Lo, these many years do I serve thee, neither transgressed I at any time thy commandment: and yet thou never gavest me a kid, that I might make merry with my friends:
30: <sup>30</sup> But as soon as this thy son was come, which hath devoured thy living with harlots, thou hast killed for him the fatted calf.
31: <sup>31</sup> And he said unto him, Son, thou art ever with me, and all that I have is thine.
32: <sup>32</sup> It was meet that we should make merry, and be glad: for this thy brother was dead, and is alive again; and was lost, and is found.
33: <sup>33</sup> And when the sixth hour was come, there was darkness over the whole land until the ninth hour.
34: <sup>34</sup> And at the ninth hour Jesus cried with a loud voice, saying, Eloi, Eloi, lama sabachthani? which is, being interpreted, My God, my God, why hast thou forsaken me?
35: <sup>35</sup> And some of them that stood by, when they heard it, said, Behold, he calleth Elias.
36: <sup>36</sup> And one ran and filled a spunge full of vinegar, and put it on a reed, and gave him to drink, saying, Let alone; let us see whether Elias will come to take him down.
37: <sup>37</sup> And Jesus cried with a loud voice, and gave up the ghost.
38: <sup>38</sup> And the veil of the temple was rent in twain from the top to the bottom.
39: <sup>39</sup> And when the centurion, which stood over against him, saw that he so cried out, and gave up the ghost, he said, Truly this man was the Son of God.
40: <sup>40</sup> There were also women looking on afar off: among whom was Mary Magdalene, and Mary the mother of James the less and of Joses, and Salome;
41: <sup>41</sup> (Who also, when he was in Galilee, followed him, and ministered unto him;) and many other women which came up with him unto Jerusalem.
42: <sup>42</sup> And now when the even was come, because it was the preparation, that is, the day before the sabbath,
43: <sup>43</sup> Joseph of Arimathaea, an honourable counsellor, which also waited for the kingdom of God, came, and went in boldly unto Pilate, and craved the body of Jesus.
44: <sup>44</sup> And Pilate marvelled if he were already dead: and calling unto him the centurion, he asked him whether he had been any while dead.
45: <sup>45</sup> And when he knew it of the centurion, he gave the body to Joseph.
46: <sup>46</sup> And he bought fine linen, and took him down, and wrapped him in the linen, and laid him in a sepulchre which was hewn out of a rock, and rolled a stone unto the door of the sepulchre.
47: <sup>47</sup> And Mary Magdalene and Mary the mother of Joses beheld where he was laid.
